text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies!

Ro: Today I have a special guest, this is
my Dad!

Dad: Hi guys, great being here. Ro: Papa Pizza,
right here!

Ro: Today I invited him on because he was
visiting and I got so many requests

Ro: to do something Disney related, for Frozen.
Dad: Mmmhmmm, mmmhmmm.

Ro: Biggest Disney Fan… Dad: I am. Ro: Ever,
has every movie. Dad: I am.
Ro: What’s your favorite?

Dad: Well right now it’s Frozen, it’s
kind of a real tear jerker.
Ro: Dawwwww. Dad: It’s a favorite.

Ro: So today, we are gonna be making Olaf
Frozen Treats, so what you do is take

Ro: your finger, spin it in a circle and we’re
gonna say let’s get started.
Dad: I’m ready.
Ro: OK.
Both: Let’s get started!

Ro: The things you will need, will be: Flour,
vanilla ice cream, sugar cookie mix, or

Ro: you can use your favorite sugar cookie
recipe, this calls for 1/3 cup of

Ro: butter and 1 egg, hot fudge, chocolate
melts, I’m using dark chocolate melts,

Ro: 2 cookie cutters, this is a tear shaped
cookie cutter, and this 1’s a little heart
Ro: cookie cutter. You’ll also need…

Dad: Well we need 6, uh, dessert glasses,
or shot glasses.

Ro: They do look like shot glasses for whiskey
whiskers over here. Check out my Dad’s

Ro: ‘stache, best ‘stache ever. You should
give this video a like if you like
Ro: my Dad’s ‘stache!

Dad: We also need a ice cream scoop. Ro: Mmmhmm.
Dad: Pair of scissors. Ro: Yep.

Dad: Rolling pin, wax paper, and a cookie
baking sheet.

Ro: Yep, that’s it, now let’s put it all
together!

Dad: Let’s get to baking. Ro: Yeah, let’s
get to baking. OK, I’ll let you pour that

Ro: in the bowl. Dad: OK. Ro: And, I’ll
lift this up, OK pour that in there.

Dad: This is sugar cookie mix, this is really
good. Ro: Yeah, sugar cookie mix.

Ro: Oh gosh, oh gosh, supposed to be room
temperature, really, really soft.

Ro: I put it in the microwave for a little
bit too long.

Ro: OK, then I’m gonna let you crack the
egg. Dad: Sure. Ro: And then you can put the...

Ro: Whoa, 1 handed egg crack! Boom! That’s
where I get it!

Ro: Now you’re just gonna mix this up for
about 2 minutes until everything’s
Ro: really combined.
Dad: Sounds like my old car.

Ro: Now we’re gonna roll out our cookies
and cut our shapes, we’re gonna make

Ro: Olaf’s little face. Dad: Mmmhmm. Ro:
To stick on top of our ice cream.
Dad: Excellent.

Ro: So, take a little bit of flour and put
it on the surface, go like this.

Ro: Now I’m gonna need you to knead the
dough. Dad: Hoh-oh yeah.
Ro: Ah-her-her-her-her!

Dad: Where’d you learn all this anyway?
Ro: I don’t know…

Ro: Nana, she’s always baking. Dad: Nana,
that’s right!

Ro: Just keep adding flour to your dough so
that it’s not sticky anymore.

Ro: ‘Cuz when you cut shapes out you just
want your dough to not stick to your hands.
Dad: How many cookies are we gonna make today?

Ro: A million-bajillion! Dad: Oh I love cookies!
Ro: A-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!

Ro: Now take your rolling pin, bew-bew-bew!
And roll out your cookie dough.

Dad: I remember you used to eat cookie dough.
Ro: Yeah! I still do!
Dad: Yeah, that’s pretty good stuff!

Ro: Papa Pizza what are you doing over here?
Dad: Oh yeah, thats…

Ro: Oh you’re saving that? Dad: I’m saving
this.

Dad: That is so good! Ro: Hey gimme some
of dat!

Ro: OK, now you’re gonna take your tear
shape, and you’re just gonna cut out a bunch of

Ro: tear shapes. Now that you’ve got your
tear shape cookies all cut out what we’re

Ro: gonna do is define Olaf’s head, so this
pointy end right here Dad, do you see that?

Dad: Mmmhmm, mmmhmm. Ro: That is gonna go
into our ice cream. Dad: Mmmhmmm.

Ro: And so on this top end, the rounded part,
we’re just gonna on each side,

Ro: use the side of your heart, to make 2
little cuts like this, bewp, dewp!

Ro: And then you’re gonna round it. Because
when he smiling, that’s what Olaf’s
Ro: head kind of looks like.

Dad: OK, once you have your cookies ready,
heat your oven to 350.

Ro: And bake for 6 minutes, and while these
are baking, we’re gonna be making some

Ro: chocolate decorations. Dad: Mmmm, chocolate!
Ro: Nom, nom, nom, nom, nom!

Ro: If I had a mustache, I’d be doing this
right now, like that.

Dad: I bet you wish you had one. Ro: Om-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!
I do….

Ro: While your cookies are baking in the oven,
we’re gonna make chocolate

Ro: decorations, for Olaf’s arms… And
his little hairs.

Ro: Did he give me? He always gives bunny
ears! In every family photo,

Ro: he will get you, watch out, he’s a sneaky
one Papa Pizza.

Ro: Alright, so what I did is I printed off
little images of his hands, right here.

Ro: And I’ll put a link down below so if
you’d like to use the 1 I used.

Ro: It was really easy, just in photoshop.
And then I printed off a lot of pictures
Ro: of his hair.

Dad: Tape these down? Ro: Yeah, you’re gonna
tape these down, I’m just taping them

Ro: on a piece of cardboard, just any flat
surface will do, so they won’t move.

Ro: And then you’re gonna take a piece of
wax paper, mewr!

Ro: And you’re gonna just put it on the
top and tape it down.

Ro: Then what we did is we just took a bunch of
those chocolate melts, and we put it in a

Ro: plastic bag with a number 2 tip at the
end, just so we’d have a little bit more

Ro: control of our design. And I’ll show
you how to do this, how to decorate chocolate.

Ro: So we’re just gonna trace the image
of his little hand, it does not have to

Ro: be perfect, because they’re twigs. So
if it looks a little
Ro: messy that’s probably perfect!

Ro: Then you’re just gonna trace every little
design.

Ro: Once you’ve got all of your little arms
and hair pieces done, you’re gonna pop

Ro: these into the freezer for 10 minutes,
and you’re gonna take your melted chocolate

Ro: and our little dessert glasses, and you’re
gonna make 2 dots on the side of the
Ro: cup… To look like his little “buddens.”

Dad: You know, we just took these out of the
oven, what do we do next?

Ro: Now, we are going to decorate them with
a little bit of cookie icing.

Ro: I’ve got white cookie icing and black
cookie icing, and I’ll show you what to do.

Ro: So 1st we’re just gonna do an outline,
and you don’t need to do the bottom of the

Ro: cookie, because that’s gonna be sticking
into the ice cream.

Ro: And then, we’re gonna make a smile because
those are his cheeks. Boom!

Ro: And you’re just gonna do this to all
of your cookies, and then, in 10 minutes

Ro: you’re just gonna fill it in with the
white. Then you’re gonna take your black,
Ro: and you’re gonna fill in the smile.

Ro: Once you’ve got your cookies all frosted,
like we’ve done, you are gonna get these

Ro: orange slices, these little candy gummy
orange slices, and you’re gonna cut off

Ro: the corners with your baking scissors,
and you’re gonna stick them right into

Ro: the middle, awww, to be little Olaf’s
nose! Check that out!

Ro: Now we are gonna assemble all of our frozen
treats, and we’re gonna show you
Ro: how to do 1 first.

Ro: So what you’re gonna do, I took some
hot fudge, I put ‘em in a plastic bag, just

Ro: so I could control it a little bit better.
You can also use a squeezy bottle.

Ro: I’m just gonna snip the tip, and I’m
just gonna put a little bit of hot
Ro: fudge at the bottom of our cups.

Ro: Now Dad’s gonna do 2 scoops of vanilla
ice cream, get it in there!

Ro: And, you’re gonna take a little head,
stick him right in the middle.
Ro: Oh he’s so cute!

Ro: And then, you’re gonna stick in the
2 chocolate arms and attach his hair with
Ro: a little bit of frosting on the back.
Ro: Ta-da!

Ro: Here are our Frozen Olaf Treats, they’re
so cute and so yummy.

Ro: I hope you guys like ‘em, thanks for
suggesting them. And thanks Dad
Ro: for helping me out.

Dad: Oh, you’re welcome. Ro: Awwwwww! I
love this guy!

Ro: Alright, if you guys have any other suggestions
for any other Nerdy Nummies,

Ro: Nerdy Nummies! Please let me know, leave
me a comment down below and I

Ro: will do my best to make ‘em happen.
Also, you can follow me on Facebook, Twitter,

Ro: Tumblr, Instagram, all the social medias
that Dad does not have.

Dad: Hmmm-mmmm. Ro: Nope, Papa Pizza doesn’t
have, but you guys probably do.

Ro: And I will post lots of pictures of these
cute little treats, and if you make

Ro: these, please send me a picture because
I get a big kick out of it.
Ro: I love seeing baking creations.
Ro: Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Dad: Elevator… Both: Ding!
Ro: Hmm-hmm-hmm-hmm! Tee-hee-hee-hee!
